title: 10 Things to Master About Javascript Before You Call Yourself a Pro
content: Javascript has changed a lot over the years and has become one of the most popular languages out there. It is mine and lots of developer's favorite/preferred coding language so here are 10 things you should definitely try to master first.
author: Before Semicolon

title: What’s New In Create React App 4
subtitle: What to expect from the release
content: Create-React-App allows us to scaffold new React applications. It’s an incredibly useful tool for building React applications. It keeps all of our dev dependencies like webpack, ESLint and babel inside of react-scripts. That means, that in order to update these dependencies, we need to wait for an update to Create-React-App. Lucky for us, that day is here.
author: Malcolm Laing

title: How To Optimize React App For Production And Deploy It To Heroku
subtitle: Understand what it takes to make your React application faster
content: In this article we will see, how we can optimize the react app we created in the previous article
author: Yogesh Chavan

title: Run Node.js + React + Webpack on Heroku
content: To develope a website, I decide to use React and Node.js. For convinient, I also use Webpack for debuging. In the production version of my website, I do not need Webpack at all, so Webpack dependencies are put in devDependencies in package.json. That is a starting of a nighmare for me…
author: Angcar

title: 7 Small Acts That Make You An Extraordinary Partner
subtitle: Practice the golden rule of relationships
content: When my long-distance girlfriend dropped me off at the airport, I sensed it would be the last time we saw each other. We had been dating only five months and had depleted our vacation days, air miles, and cash.
author: Barry Davret
